Clause: its planned rights offering to raise about $9 million was declared effective
and the company will begin mailing materials to shareholders at the end of this week.
Under the offer, shareholders will receive one right for each 105 common shares
Each right entitles the shareholder to buy $100 face amount of 13.5% bonds due 1993
and warrants to buy 23.5 common shares at 30 cents a share.
Integra, which owns and operates hotels,
that Hallwood Group Inc. has agreed to exercise any rights
that aren't exercised by other shareholders.
Hallwood, a Cleveland merchant bank, owns about 11% of Integra.
